what: Defining a Basic Structural Model with rjd3sts
title: BSM
text: package allows several equivalent definitions basic structural model. present . compare results (precisely likelihood) different approaches, important compute marginal likelihood.
code: s<-log(retail$BookStores)

previous_headings: Defining a Basic Structural Model with rjd3sts
what: Standard definition, noise in the state
title: BSM
code: # create the model bsm<-model() # create the components and add them to the model add(bsm, locallineartrend("ll")) add(bsm, seasonal("s", 12, type="HarrisonStevens")) add(bsm, noise("n")) rslt<-estimate(bsm, log(s), marginal=TRUE)

previous_headings: Defining a Basic Structural Model with rjd3sts
what: Standard definition, noise in the measurement
title: BSM
code: # create the model bsm<-model() # create the components and add them to the model add(bsm, locallineartrend("ll")) add(bsm, seasonal("s", 12, type="HarrisonStevens"))   # create the equation (fix the variance to 1) eq<-equation("eq", 1,TRUE) add_equation(eq, "ll") add_equation(eq, "s") add(bsm, eq) rslt<-estimate(bsm, log(s), marginal=TRUE)

previous_headings: Defining a Basic Structural Model with rjd3sts
what: components with fixed variances, aggregated with diffuse weights (noise in the state)
title: BSM
text: Likelihood = 747.8184944 Parameters = 1.0000, 0.0025, 1.0000, 1.0000, 0.4001, 0.4939 noted: Level variance = \(p[5]\times p[5]\) = 0.160057 Slope variance = \(p[5]\times p[5] \times p[2]\) = 0.000396 Seas variance = \(p[6]\times p[6]\) = 0.243976
code: # create the model bsm<-model()   # create the components, with fixed variances, and add them to the model add(bsm, locallineartrend("ll",                               levelVariance = 1, fixedLevelVariance = TRUE) ) add(bsm, seasonal("s", 12, type="HarrisonStevens",                       variance = 1, fixed = TRUE)) add(bsm, noise("n", 1, fixed=TRUE))   # create the equation (fix the variance to 1) eq<-equation("eq", 0, TRUE) add_equation(eq, "ll", .01, FALSE) add_equation(eq, "s", .01, FALSE) add_equation(eq, "n") add(bsm, eq) rslt<-estimate(bsm, log(s), marginal=TRUE) p<-result(rslt, "parameters")

previous_headings: Defining a Basic Structural Model with rjd3sts
what: bsm with long term trend and cycle
title: BSM
code: # create the model bsm<-model()   # create the components and add them to the model add(bsm, locallevel("l", initial = 0) ) add(bsm, locallineartrend("lt", levelVariance = 0,                               fixedLevelVariance = TRUE) ) add(bsm, seasonal("s", 12, type="HarrisonStevens")) add(bsm, noise("n", 1, fixed=TRUE))   # create the equation (fix the variance to 1) rslt<-estimate(bsm, log(s), marginal=TRUE) ss<-smoothed_states(rslt) plot(ss[,1]+ss[,2], type='l', col='blue', ylab='trends') lines(ss[, 2], col='red')

what: Use of regular periodic cubic splines
title: Regular periodic cubic splines

previous_headings: Use of regular periodic cubic splines
what: Usual BSM with Harrison-Stevens seasonal component
title: Regular periodic cubic splines
code: model<-model()  llt<-locallineartrend('l') seas<-seasonal("s", 12, "HarrisonStevens") n<-noise('n') add(model, llt) add(model, seas) add(model, n)  rslt<-estimate(model, s)  sa1<-result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.components")

previous_headings: Use of regular periodic cubic splines
what: BSM with full periodic splines seasonal component
title: Regular periodic cubic splines
text: results first two models identical (numerical precision)
code: model<-model() seas<-splines_regular("s", 12, nodes=c(0:11)) add(model, llt) add(model, seas) add(model, n)  rslt<-estimate(model, s)  sa2<-result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.components")  summary(sa1[,2]-sa2[,2]) #>       Min.    1st Qu.     Median       Mean    3rd Qu.       Max.  #> -3.099e-07 -4.402e-08 -4.641e-10  2.138e-10  4.262e-08  2.310e-07

previous_headings: Use of regular periodic cubic splines
what: BSM with partial periodic splines seasonal component
title: Regular periodic cubic splines
code: model<-model() seas<-splines_regular("s", 12, nodes=c(1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11)) add(model, llt) add(model, seas) add(model, n)  rslt<-estimate(model, s)  sa3<-result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.components")   matplot(cbind(sa1[301:336,2],sa2[301:336,2],sa3[301:336,2]), type='l', ylab="Seasonal")

title: Sructural Time Series using JDemetra+
text: illustrate various methods using two sets time series: retail data set contains monthly figures US retail activity various categories goods services 1992 2010. ABS data set contains long monthly series Australian retail trade.

title: Time varying trading days
text: state space framework allows easy estimation time-varying trading days effects.
code: # take a (transformed) series s<-log(rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M)

title: Time varying trading days
text: model effects integrating state array regression coefficients. usual, regression variables modeled using contrasts (instance: #days-#Sundays). coefficient follow multivariate random walk. usual regression, put constraint sum coefficients 0 (implies one coefficient derived others). noted fixed coefficients correspond innovation random walk. consider innovation variance applies coefficients day (option contrast=FALSE) contrasts (option contrast=TRUE). latter case, variance innovation contrasting (group ) days larger. time varying trading days can plugged representation series.

title: Time varying trading days
code: # create the model model<-rjd3sts::model()  # create the components and add them to the model rjd3sts::add(model, rjd3sts::sarima("airline", 12, c(0,1,1), c(0,1,1)))  rjd3sts::add(model, vtd<-rjd3sts::reg_td("td", 12, start(s), length(s), contrast = FALSE)) #estimate the model rslt<-rjd3sts::estimate(model, s)  ss<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.states") vss<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.vstates")

title: Time varying trading days
text: results can retrieved “result” function. available information displayed means “dictionary” method Time varying trading days
code: print(rjd3toolkit::dictionary(rslt)) #>  [1] "likelihood.ll"                   "likelihood.ser"                  #>  [3] "likelihood.residuals"            "scalingfactor"                   #>  [5] "ssf.ncmps"                       "ssf.cmppos"                      #>  [7] "ssf.cmpnames"                    "parameters"                      #>  [9] "parametersnames"                 "fn.parameters"                   #> [11] "ssf.T(*)"                        "ssf.V(*)"                        #> [13] "ssf.Z(*)"                        "ssf.P0"                          #> [15] "ssf.B0"                          "ssf.smoothing.array(?)"          #> [17] "ssf.smoothing.varray(?)"         "ssf.smoothing.cmp(?)"            #> [19] "ssf.smoothing.vcmp(?)"           "ssf.smoothing.components(?)"     #> [21] "ssf.smoothing.fastcomponents(?)" "ssf.smoothing.vcomponents(?)"    #> [23] "ssf.smoothing.state(?)"          "ssf.smoothing.vstate(?)"         #> [25] "ssf.smoothing.states"            "ssf.smoothing.vstates"           #> [27] "ssf.filtering.array(?)"          "ssf.filtering.varray(?)"         #> [29] "ssf.filtering.cmp(?)"            "ssf.filtering.vcmp(?)"           #> [31] "ssf.filtering.state(?)"          "ssf.filtering.states"            #> [33] "ssf.filtering.vstates"           "ssf.filtering.vstate(?)"         #> [35] "ssf.filtered.array(?)"           "ssf.filtered.varray(?)"          #> [37] "ssf.filtered.cmp(?)"             "ssf.filtered.vcmp(?)"            #> [39] "ssf.filtered.state(?)"           "ssf.filtered.vstate(?)"          #> [41] "ssf.filtered.states"             "ssf.filtered.vstates" colfunc<-colorRampPalette(c("red","blue","green","#196F3D")) colors <- (colfunc(7))  pos<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.cmppos") plot(ss[,pos[2]+1], type='l', col=colors[1], ylim=c(-0.04, 0.03), ylab='coeff') lines(ss[,pos[2]+2], col=colors[2]) lines(ss[,pos[2]+3], col=colors[3]) lines(ss[,pos[2]+4], col=colors[4]) lines(ss[,pos[2]]+5, col=colors[5]) lines(ss[,pos[2]+6], col=colors[6]) lines(-rowSums(ss[,pos[2]+(1:6)]), col=colors[7])

title: Time varying trading days
code: # take a (transformed) series s<-log(rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M)  # create the model model<-rjd3sts::model()  # create the components and add them to the model llt<-rjd3sts::locallineartrend('l') seas<-rjd3sts::seasonal("s", 12, "HarrisonStevens") n<-rjd3sts::noise('n') rjd3sts::add(model, llt) rjd3sts::add(model, seas) rjd3sts::add(model, n) rjd3sts::add(model, vtd<-rjd3sts::reg_td("td", 12, start(s), length(s), contrast = FALSE)) #estimate the model rslt<-rjd3sts::estimate(model, s)  ss<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.states") vss<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.smoothing.vstates") colfunc<-colorRampPalette(c("red","blue","green","#196F3D")) colors <- (colfunc(7))  pos<-rjd3toolkit::result(rslt, "ssf.cmppos") plot(ss[,pos[4]+1], type='l', col=colors[1], ylim=c(-0.04, 0.03), ylab='coeff') lines(ss[,pos[4]+2], col=colors[2]) lines(ss[,pos[4]+3], col=colors[3]) lines(ss[,pos[4]+4], col=colors[4]) lines(ss[,pos[4]]+5, col=colors[5]) lines(ss[,pos[4]+6], col=colors[6]) lines(-rowSums(ss[,pos[4]+(1:6)]), col=colors[7])

title: Authors and Citation
text: Palate J (2024). rjd3sts: State Space Framework Structural Time Series 'JDemetra+ 3.x'. R package version 2.1.1, https://rjdverse.github.io/rjd3sts, https://github.com/rjdverse/rjd3sts.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rjd3sts: State Space Framework and Structural Time Series with 'JDemetra+ 3.x'},   author = {Jean Palate},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.1.1, https://rjdverse.github.io/rjd3sts},   url = {https://github.com/rjdverse/rjd3sts}, }

title: State Space Framework and Structural Time Series with JDemetra+ 3.x
text: Running rjd3 packages requires Java 17 higher. set configuration R explained get current stable version (latest release): get current development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rjdverse/rjd3toolkit@*release") remotes::install_github("rjdverse/rjd3sts@*release") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rjdverse/rjd3sts")

title: State Space Framework and Structural Time Series with JDemetra+ 3.x
code: library("rjd3sts") #>  #> Attaching package: 'rjd3sts' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     ar, arima, cycle y <- log(rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M) days<-c(1,1,1,1,2,3,0)  model<-rjd3sts::model() sarima<-rjd3sts::sarima('arima', 12, orders=c(0,1,1), seasonal=c(0,1,1)) td<-rjd3sts::reg_td('td', 12, start(y), length(y), variance=1, fixed=FALSE)  rjd3sts::add(model, sarima) rjd3sts::add(model, td)  rslt<-rjd3sts::estimate(model, y) cmp<-rjd3sts::smoothed_components(rslt) ss<-rjd3sts::smoothed_states(rslt)  plot(cmp[,2], type='l', ylim=c(-0.05, 0.04), col='blue', main="Time-varying td effect (+ Sundays coeff.)", xlab="", ylab="td effect") lines(-rowSums(ss[,15:20]), col='green', lwd = 3)

title: State Space Framework and Structural Time Series with JDemetra+ 3.x

what: Add a building block to the considered equation — add_equation

Add a building block to the considered equation — add_equation
code: add_equation(equation, item, coeff = 1, fixed = TRUE, loading = NULL)

title: Add a building block to the considered equation — add_equation
text: equation equation item block state array linked observation corresponding equation specified loading coefficient coeff value coefficient associated block latent variables defined item. fixed logical triggers estimation coeff (FALSE) fixes (TRUE) pre-specified value loading loading links block observation

title: Title — aggregation
code: aggregation(name, components)

title: Autoregressive model — ar
text: Functions create autoregressive model (ar) modified autoregressive model (ar2)

title: Autoregressive model — ar
code: ar(   name,   ar,   fixedar = FALSE,   variance = 0.01,   fixedvariance = FALSE,   nlags = 0,   zeroinit = FALSE )  ar2(   name,   ar,   fixedar = FALSE,   variance = 0.01,   fixedvariance = FALSE,   nlags = 0,   nfcasts = 0 )

title: Autoregressive model — ar
text: ar vector AR coefficients (\(\varphi_1, \dots, \varphi_p\)). fixedar boolean triggers estimation AR coefficients (FALSE) fixed (TRUE) pre-specified value set parameter ar. variance variance (\(\sigma^2_{ar}\)). fixedvariance boolean triggers estimation variance (FALSE) fixed (TRUE) pre-specified value set parameter variance. nlags integer specifying many lags state variable needed zeroinit boolean determining initial condition state variable, equal zero zeroinit = TRUE. default (zeroinit = FAKSE) triggers initialization based unconditional mean variance AR(p) process. nfcasts integer specifying many forecasts state variable needed

title: Autoregressive model — ar
text: AR process defined $$\Phi\left(B\right)y_t=\epsilon_t$$ $$\Phi\left(B\right)=1+\varphi_1 B + \cdots + \varphi_p B^p$$ auto-regressive polynomial.

what: Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) Model — arima

Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) Model — arima
code: arima(name, ar, diff, ma, var = 1, fixed = FALSE)

title: Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) Model — arima
Autoregressive Moving Average (ARMA) Model — arma
code: arma(name, ar, fixedar = FALSE, ma, fixedma = FALSE, var = 1, fixedvar = FALSE)

title: Estimate a SSF Model — estimate
code: estimate(   model,   data,   marginal = FALSE,   concentrated = TRUE,   initialization = c("Augmented_Robust", "Diffuse", "SqrtDiffuse", "Augmented",     "Augmented_NoCollapsing"),   optimizer = c("LevenbergMarquardt", "MinPack", "BFGS", "LBFGS"),   precision = 1e-15,   initialParameters = NULL )

title: Estimate a SSF Model — estimate
text: model model data matrix containing data (one time series per column, time series dimension rows) marginal logical value used specify whether marginal likelihood definition used (TRUE) (FALSE) optimization. marginal likelihood recommended least one variable loads non-stationary latent variable loading coefficient needs estimated. concentrated logical value used specify whether likelihood concentrated (TRUE) (FALSE) optimization initialization initialization method. precision indicating largest likelihood deviations make algorithm stop. initialParameters

title: Local Level — locallevel
text: name name component. variance value variance (\(\sigma^2_l\)). fixed boolean triggers estimation \(\sigma^2_l\) (FALSE) fixes (TRUE) pre-specified  value set parameter variance. initial initial value level (\(l_0\)).

title: Local Linear Trend — locallineartrend
code: locallineartrend(   name,   levelVariance = 0.01,   slopevariance = 0.01,   fixedLevelVariance = FALSE,   fixedSlopeVariance = FALSE )

title: Local Linear Trend — locallineartrend
text: name name component. levelVariance variance level (\(\sigma^2_l\)) fixedLevelVariance, fixedSlopeVariance boolean triggers estimation variances \(\sigma^2_l\) \(\sigma^2_n\) (FALSE) fixes (TRUE) pre-specified value set parameters levelVariance slopevariance.

title: Local Linear Trend — locallineartrend
text: $$\begin{cases}l_{t+1} = l_t + n_t +  \xi_t \\  n_{t+1} = n_t + \mu_t \\  \xi_t \sim N(0, \sigma^2\sigma^2_l)\\  \mu_t \sim N(0, \sigma^2\sigma^2_n)  \end{cases}$$

code: model()

what: Modeling errors in surveys with overlapping panels — msae
title: Modeling errors in surveys with overlapping panels — msae
Modeling errors in surveys with overlapping panels — msae
code: msae(name, nwaves, ar, fixedar = TRUE, lag = 1)  msae2(name, vars, fixedvars = FALSE, ar, fixedar = TRUE, lag = 1)  msae3(name, vars, fixedvars = FALSE, ar, fixedar = TRUE, k, lag = 1)

title: Modeling errors in surveys with overlapping panels — msae
text: name name component. nwaves integer representing number waves ar matrix representing covariance structure wave specific survey error. fixedar logical triggers estimation correlation patterns (TRUE) fixes values given entries ar (FALSE) lag integer specifying number time periods (base frequency) compose survey period. coincides number time periods individual wait two different waves. Note survey period one quarter, already responded previous wave exactly 3 months ago (individuals always interviewed stint survey period).

title: Title — seasonalbreaks
text: y input time series. period annual frequency. level -1 = level, 0 = fixed level, 1 = sotchastic level slope  noise  seasonal Seasonal model X Regression variables (length y) NULL X.td Groups days trading days regressors. length array must 7. indicates group week day belongs. first item corresponds Mondays last one Sundays. group used contrasts (usually Sundays) identified 0. groups identified 1, 2,... n (<= 6). instance, usual trading days defined c(1,2,3,4,5,6,0), week days c(1,1,1,1,1,0,0), etc...

text: y input time series. X Regression variables (length y) NULL X.td Groups days trading days regressors. length array must 7. indicates group week day belongs. first item corresponds Mondays last one Sundays. group used contrasts (usually Sundays) identified 0. groups identified 1, 2,... n (<= 6). instance, usual trading days defined c(1,2,3,4,5,6,0), week days c(1,1,1,1,1,0,0), etc... level -1 = level, 0 = fixed level, 1 = sotchastic level slope  cycle  noise  seasonal Seasonal model diffuse.regs  tol

title: Title — sts
code: x<-rjd3toolkit::retail$BookStores  sts(x) #> Structural time series  #>  #> Variances: #> level:  135.5975  #> slope:  0.156252  #> seasonal:  52.25239  #> noise:  174.5098  #>  #> LogLikelihood:  -1233.544  #> AIC:  2467.089  #>  #> No regression variable

title: Forecast with STS model — sts_forecast
code: sts_forecast(y, model = c("none", "td2", "td3", "td7", "full"), nf = 12)

title: Forecast with STS model — sts_forecast
text: y Series model Model calendar effects td2: leap year + week days (week-end derived) td3: leap year + week days + saturdays (sundays derived) td7: leap year + days (sundays derived) full: td3 + easter effect none: calendar effect nf number forecasts

title: Forecast with STS model — sts_forecast
code: fcasts<-sts_forecast(rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M)

title: Title — sts_outliers
code: sts_outliers(   y,   period = NA,   X = NULL,   X.td = NULL,   level = 1,   slope = 1,   noise = 1,   seasonal = c("Trigonometric", "Dummy", "Crude", "HarrisonStevens", "Fixed", "Unused"),   ao = TRUE,   ls = TRUE,   so = FALSE,   cv = 0,   tcv = 0,   estimation.forward = c("Score", "Point", "Full"),   estimation.backward = c("Point", "Score", "Full") )

title: Title — sts_outliers
text: y input time series. period annual frequency. X Regression variables (length y) NULL X.td Groups days trading days regressors. length array must 7. indicates group week day belongs. first item corresponds Mondays last one Sundays. group used contrasts (usually Sundays) identified 0. groups identified 1, 2,... n (<= 6). instance, usual trading days defined c(1,2,3,4,5,6,0), week days c(1,1,1,1,1,0,0), etc... level -1 = level, 0 = fixed level, 1 = sotchastic level slope  noise  seasonal Seasonal model ao, ls, boolean indicating additive outliers (ao), level shift (ls) seasonal outliers () detected. cv  tcv  estimation.forward  estimation.backward

title: Time Varying Regressor — var_reg
code: x<-rjd3toolkit::retail$BookStores  std<-rep(1, length(x))  std[c(20, 50, 150)]<-5  v<-var_reg("vx", x, std, 0.1)

title: Title — var_seasonal
code: var_seasonal(   name,   period,   type = c("Trigonometric", "Crude", "HarrisonStevens", "Dummy"),   std,   scale = 1,   fixed = FALSE )
